item.title: Michael Burry Warns of Cascading Effects From Bitcoin Plunge
item.description: Famed investor Michael Burry warned that Bitcoin’s slump through some important thresholds could have cascading effects leading to massive value destruction.

item.title: US Military Build Up Seen Giving Puerto Rico $833 Million Bump
item.description: The beefed up US military presence in the Caribbean, designed to crack down on drug routes and turn the screws on Venezuela and Cuba, is set to deliver economic gains for Puerto Rico.

item.title: Smaller Fed Balance Sheet Requires More Active Fed, Mizuho Says
item.description: Kevin Warsh, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Federal Reserve, has been vocal about his desire to shrink the central bank’s balance sheet. To do so will require a more “interventionist” Fed when it comes to day-to-day money market operations, according to Mizhuo Securities USA LLC.

item.title: Google Search Ruling to be Appealed by DOJ, States
item.description: A group of states led by Colorado will appeal a federal judge’s ruling that imposed only modest limits on Alphabet Inc.’s Google contracts related to its search engine and artificial intelligence apps.

item.title: Brookfield Near Deal to Sell London’s CityPoint Office Tower
item.description: Brookfield Corp. is in exclusive negotiations to sell London’s CityPoint office tower for roughly the value of the outstanding debt secured against it.

item.title: Skillsoft Lenders Tap Counsel Again as Software Distress Worsens
item.description: Some lenders to Skillsoft Corp. re-engaged law firm Gibson Dunn & Crutcher for legal advice as its loans fall deeper into distress, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Import Costs Driving Canada Food Inflation, BOC Research Says
item.description: Bank of Canada research suggests the acceleration in food inflation last year was almost entirely due to rising import costs, not domestic factors.

item.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Set to Defend Deal Before Skeptical Panel
item.description: Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. will face a skeptical Senate panel Tuesday to defend their $82.7 billion media merger against allegations it will hurt competition in the streaming market.

item.title: Altman Says OpenAI May Back Firms Using AI for Drug Discovery
item.description: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said his company may consider investing in or subsidizing firms that make significant use of its AI technologies to discover new drugs or therapies, and possibly take a royalty in exchange

item.title: Alternative Asset Firm Dawson to Debut Credit Secondary Strategy
item.description: Dawson Partners, an early mover in helping investors extract cash from private equity stakes, plans to start a strategy for the fast-growing credit secondaries market.

item.title: Uber’s Risks From Self Driving to Take Center Stage of Earnings
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc.’s quarterly results will likely take a back seat to the mounting threat posed by the growing self-driving fleets from prominent rivals like Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo and Elon Musk-led Tesla Inc., according to Wall Street analysts.

item.title: Texas Considers Revisiting Some Data Center Grid Approvals
item.description: Texas has so many massive AI-related data centers in development that its grid operator is now considering reevaluating some projects that were previously approved.

item.title: Bitcoin Drops to Lowest Price Since Trump’s Election Victory
item.description: Bitcoin dropped to its lowest price level since Donald Trump retook the White House a little more than a year ago, erasing the gains registered by the bellwether digital asset since the election victory of the crypto-friendly US president.

item.title: Intel CEO Says There’s ‘No Relief’ on Memory Shortage Until 2028
item.description: Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan said that the computer industry’s memory-chip shortage is likely to persist for at least two years.

item.title: Deutsche Bank Group Stuck With Software Loans in Rare Hung Deal
item.description: A group of banks led by Deutsche Bank AG has been unable to sell about $1.2 billion of loans backing the acquisition of a software provider — the latest casualty of investor fears surrounding disruption from artificial intelligence.

item.title: 桑坦德银行考虑收购美国韦伯斯特金融公司
item.description: 知情人士透露，桑坦德银行正考虑收购美国韦伯斯特金融公司。【原文：Banco Santander SA is considering a deal to acquire US-based Webster Financial Corp., people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官表示，人工智能的建设最终将降低能源成本
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋表示，当前大规模扩建的人工智能算力正使许多地区的电网不堪重负，但最终将推动能源成本下降。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said that the massive build-out of artificial intelligence capacity, which is currently straining the power grid in many locations, will eventually lead to cheaper energy costs.】

item.title: 肯·格里芬称企业高管不愿对美国总统"阿谀奉承"
item.description: 城堡投资集团的肯·格里芬表示，特朗普政府奖励亲信的做法在商界高管中反响不佳，并批评总统在任期间为家族谋取私利的行径。【原文：Citadel’s Ken Griffin said the Trump administration’s tendency to reward loyalists doesn’t play well with business executives and criticized the president’s willingness to enrich his family while in office.】

item.title: 美银称金银价格暴跌后波动性将持续
item.description: 美国银行表示，在贵金属从历史高位暴跌后，金银市场的波动性仍将居高不下。【原文：Volatility in the gold and silver markets will remain elevated after the precious metals crashed from all-time highs, according to Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 一场重大的企业思维转变
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读本期通讯，这里汇集了Odd Lots世界每日精选内容。有时是我们——乔·韦森索尔和特蕾西·阿洛威——为您解读市场、金融与经济领域的最新动态；有时则是我们专家嘉宾及信息源网络的贡献。无论内容如何，我们保证始终精彩纷呈。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet计划在印度大规模扩张，而美国正限制签证发放
item.description: 字母表公司正计划大幅扩大在印度的业务规模，可能在印度科技中心班加罗尔租用数百万平方英尺的新办公空间。【原文：Alphabet Inc. is plotting to dramatically expand its presence in India, with the possibility of taking millions of square feet in new office space in Bangalore, India’s tech hub.】

item.title: Bankers Prep €2.5 Billion Debt as ContiTech Unit Sale Kicks Off
item.description: Bankers are working on debt packages of around €2.5 billion ($2.9 billion) to back a potential acquisition of Continental AG’s industrial ContiTech unit, as a highly-anticipated sales process kicks off.

item.title: 黑石集团格雷称2026年有望成为"IPO之年"
item.description: 黑石集团总裁乔恩·格雷预计，在有利的监管环境和较低利率的推动下，今年并购交易和首次公开募股将加速推进。【原文：Blackstone Inc. President Jon Gray anticipates that dealmaking and initial public offerings will accelerate this year amid a favorable regulatory environment and lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国银行加入美国银行借贷狂潮，发行债券融资
item.description: 美国银行公司已启动投资级美元债券的发售，此举进一步加剧了华尔街主要银行的密集发债浪潮。【原文：Bank of America Corp. has kicked off the sale of investment-grade dollar bonds, adding to a flurry of offerings by major Wall Street banks.】

item.title: 人工智能能否战胜蝴蝶效应？这场撼动气象界的辩论
item.description:
谷歌、微软和英伟达等公司正竞相提升长期天气预报的准确性。

【原文：

Google, Microsoft y Nvidia son algunas de las empresas que compiten por mejorar la precisión de las previsiones del clima a largo plazo.

】

item.title: 墨西哥推出以能源为核心的投资计划，助力经济提振
item.description: 墨西哥政府计划到2030年向能源项目及其他公共工程投入5.6万亿比索（约合3230亿美元），此举旨在提振近年来几乎停滞不前的经济。【原文：Mexico’s government plans to invest 5.6 trillion pesos ($323 billion) into energy projects and other public works through 2030, part of a bid to boost an economy that has barely expanded in recent years.】

item.title: 银行家们在开局动荡后，为2021年以来最繁忙的IPO周做准备
item.description: 八家公司计划在即将到来的美国首次公开募股最繁忙的一周内，共同筹集39亿美元资金，这将是四年来最繁忙的一周。【原文：Eight companies are targeting a collective $3.9 billion in what’s set to be the busiest week for US initial public offerings in more than four years.】

item.title: 加拿大寻求解决湾流纠纷，此前特朗普曾发出威胁
item.description: 加拿大政府表示，在特朗普总统提出投诉后，正与美国联邦航空管理局、通用动力公司和庞巴迪公司合作，处理湾流部分私人飞机型号的认证问题。【原文：The Canadian government says it is working with the US Federal Aviation Administration, General Dynamics Corp. and Bombardier Inc. to address certification issues for some of Gulfstream’s private jet models after a complaint made by President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 派拉蒙的埃里森婉拒了华纳兄弟的听证会邀请。
item.description: 派拉蒙天空舞影业公司首席执行官大卫·埃里森拒绝了参议院的传唤，未出席关于网飞公司与华纳兄弟探索公司拟议合并案的反垄断听证会。【原文：Paramount Skydance Corp. Chief Executive Officer David Ellison turned down an invitation to testify before the Senate at an antitrust hearing about the proposed tie-up between Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.】

item.title: Citadel证券分析师鲁布纳称，随着散户热情消退，股市反弹面临风险
item.description: 散户投资者对美股的热情正面临严峻考验，此前推动上月股市上涨的创纪录买盘浪潮已显露疲态。【原文：Retail traders’ appetite for US equities faces a tough test as the record buying wave that powered last month’s rally shows signs of fatigue.】
